text: Hector is a cluster of thunderstorms that forms every afternoon on the Tiwi Islands in Australia from September to March every year. The storms may reach up to . Hector is caused by sea breezes that collide against each other across the island, making many thunderstorms. ==History== Hector was known for forming in the same area, which made it useful for pilots in World War II for navigation. ==References== Category:Meteorology Category:Weather events
title: Hector (cloud)
